title: Peaceful place
review: Only recommended for people who like santuaries. Mussorrie has many good scenic points like company garden and lal tibba

title: good one
review: located remotely.. very few travellers visit this place.. but is worth visiting atleast once.. please travellers come here

title: Excellent Picnic Location
review: One of the best picnics I've ever had was here. Beautiful, untouched forests, crystal clear stream, a fantastic BBQ and the best bunch of kids for company.

title: Good place for Barbeque food
review: This place is less crowded. Very few person come due to a bit outside from the city. This is very nicely maintained sanctuary. Those who love sanctuary must come here for 1 day picnic. The ambience was like haven on the earth. Best place.

title: Nothing to see
review: Well you be lucky to spot any animal but the overall its a paradise for nature lovers  .. So dont know if it qualifies as a wildlife sactuary

title: Nothing Much
review: WE couldnot found this place as per our expectation as we heard a lot about this place and had a lot of expecxtations from here.

title: Dissappointing
review: This place does not have many things to enjoy. Its a just a simple place with trees and all. Do not expect someting very good fromn here.

title: nothing special
review: if you have extra day you can visit here. not wroth. nothing much to see. but maintain properly and good for picnic

title: Awesome
review: With its informational brochures and the videos on informational screens the place conserves the whatever left of mountain quails

title: The name is 'Binog Mountain Quail Wildlife Sanctuary'
review: Firstly, we need to get the name right. This is a bird sanctuary extending from Kempty Fall in the North to Doodhli Village in the south, Mussoorie in the east and the Yamuna river in the west.

title: Close by and far away.
review: This is not a strenuous hike but you'll find it so rewarding with views of Bandar Punch, the valleys and villages on the Yamuna River side, view of Sir Everett's home, and small shrine at the top. The path is beautiful among oaks mostly, you might hear a barking deer as we did, and may spy some leopard scat (or more!)

title: good place. Informative not enjoyable
review: Very nice place but its all about gathering knowledge and information but not any picnic spot or any outing area. its fun and depends how we deal with it

title: nature at its best
review: vinog hill bird sanctuary is located in the west side of mussoorie  where we used to walk there from mussoorie and took us around 2 hours nice path even children can walk to this beautiful hill

title: Dont waste time
review: Though its a beautiful drive, a little deviation from kempty falls route, its not really worth a visit. there's practically nothing there. you wont be spotting any animal or birds except some langoors & butterflies. Don't waste ur time & money.

title: Benog is the normal spelling
review: The quail has not been seen for a hundred years or so, so don;t go looking for it. The area is nestled in the big valley between Happy Valley and Benog Tibba. There is a lovely walk from the Brentwood Sanctuary up to the spur between Benog Tibba and the road to Cloud End. It was an old mining road but is only walk-able now. There is a small plant nursery near the stream with a good range of plants. Lovely setting. The road is the same dirt road for Lake Mist, cutting off from the main road to Kempty Falls.

title: Average place
review: This is average place to visit not too fantastic not too bad. Go if you have enough time in mussorie.
